title: Steppin' Out with the Grateful Dead: England '72 / 4CD / V0
description:
Culling performances from seven English shows from the spring of 1972, â€œSteppinâ€™ Out With The Grateful Dead: England â€˜72â€ has much more of a "live" feel than the â€œEurope '72â€ release.

The pure ebb and flow of the shows has been thoroughly maintained by compilation producer David Lemieux - who likewise came up aces with the song selection.

Of particular interest here is a rippling, sprite reading of "Sitting on Top of the World", a couple of lesser-known Pigpen originals ("Chinatown Shuffle" and "The Stranger"), and versions of chestnuts "Hey Bo Diddley" (in a "Not Fade Away" sandwich) and "Rockin' Pneumonia and the Boogie Woogie Flu" that most folks have not heard Deadified. 

â€œTruckinâ€™ > Drums > The Other One > El Paso > The Other One > Wharf Rat.â€ â€œThe Other Oneâ€ is 30 minutes long and moves from explorative and spacey to full scale raging. There's also a wonderful and lengthy "Dark Star"/"Sugar Magnolia"/"Caution" combo. 

(Note: All of these concerts were later released in their entirety on â€œEurope '72: The Complete Recordingsâ€)
